contents.name: contents
contents.comment: The contents of the file, in bytes.

textContents.name: textContents
textContents.comment: The contents of the file as a String. Assumes UTF-8 encoding.

matcher.name: matcher
matcher.comment: Creates a new text scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor with scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.FileDescriptor-matcher.name that matches its String contents against scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.FileDescriptor-matcher.matcher. If the file is created, it's considered to be empty.

binaryMatcher.name: binaryMatcher
binaryMatcher.comment: Creates a new binary scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor with scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.FileDescriptor-binaryMatcher.name that matches its binary contents against scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.FileDescriptor-binaryMatcher.matcher. If the file is created, it's considered to be empty.

binary.name: binary
binary.comment: Creates a new binary scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor descriptor with scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.FileDescriptor-binary.name and scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.FileDescriptor-binary.contents.

create.name: create
create.comment:
Schedules the creation of the described entry within the scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.create.parent directory. Returns a scheduled_test/dart-async.Future that completes after the creation is done.

scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.create.parent defaults to scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.defaultRoot.

validate.name: validate
validate.comment:
Schedules the validation of the described entry. This validates that the physical file system under scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.validate.parent contains an entry that matches the one described by this. Returns a scheduled_test/dart-async.Future that completes to null if the entry is valid, or throws an error if it failed.

scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.validate.parent defaults to scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.defaultRoot.

validateNow.name: validateNow
validateNow.comment: An unscheduled version of scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.validate. This is useful if validation errors need to be caught, since otherwise they'd be registered by the schedule.

read.name: read
read.comment:
Returns the contents of this as a stream. This only works if this is a file entry. This operation is not scheduled_test/scheduled_test.scheduled.

All errors in loading the file will be passed through the returned scheduled_test/dart-async.Stream.

describe.name: describe
describe.comment: Returns a detailed tree-style description of this.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

create.name: create
create.comment:
Schedules the creation of the described entry within the scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.create.parent directory. Returns a scheduled_test/dart-async.Future that completes after the creation is done.

scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.create.parent defaults to scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.defaultRoot.

validate.name: validate
validate.comment:
Schedules the validation of the described entry. This validates that the physical file system under scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.validate.parent contains an entry that matches the one described by this. Returns a scheduled_test/dart-async.Future that completes to null if the entry is valid, or throws an error if it failed.

scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.validate.parent defaults to scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.defaultRoot.

validateNow.name: validateNow
validateNow.comment: An unscheduled version of scheduled_test/scheduled_test-descriptor.FileDescriptor.validate. This is useful if validation errors need to be caught, since otherwise they'd be registered by the schedule.

describe.name: describe
describe.comment: Returns a detailed tree-style description of this.

read.name: read
read.comment:
Returns the contents of this as a stream. This only works if this is a file entry. This operation is not scheduled_test/scheduled_test.scheduled.

All errors in loading the file will be passed through the returned scheduled_test/dart-async.Stream.
